biography: Peter Stuart Isaacson AM, DFC, AFC, DFM (31 July 1920 â€“ ) was owner and publisher of the Southern Cross and the Sunday Observer in Melbourne. He was also a war-time pilot, during which time he was awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross, the Air Force Cross and the Distinguished Flying Medal. He was famous for flying under the Sydney Harbour Bridge towards the end of World War II and served as the Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees until it was dissolved by the Victorian State Government
